title: Odesa's Stanislav Skrinnik, ballet dancer by night and weapons manufacturer by day
summary: When he's not performing on stage, the star dancer at the Odesa National Academic Opera and Ballet Theatre manufactures military equipment for the Ukrainian army in a secret workshop.

title: Onboard a plane dropping aid over starving and devastated Gaza
summary: On Tuesday, 16 airplanes from eight countries, including France, dropped 110 tonnes of food and other aid for the Gazans caught up in the war between Israel and Hamas. A team from Le Monde was on board one of the aircraft.

title: In Italy, a far-right MP wants to take over the country's second-largest press agency
summary: Employees of the agency AGI, owned by the state-owned ENI group, fear that it will join the media outlets already bought by Lega Nord MP Antonio Angelucci.

title: German industry's relationship with China is at a tipping point
summary: Berlin will have to arbitrate between the interests of its major groups, which continue to expand in China, and the future of German industrial sites.

title: ExxonMobil to downsize operations in France and cut 677 jobs by 2025
summary: The American giant is set to shut down part of the petrochemical activities at its major site in northern France, considered unprofitable, and is selling its Fos-sur-Mer refinery in southern France to an American-Swiss consortium.

title: TikTok Lite, a new app quietly released in France that rewards screen time
summary: Chinese giant ByteDance is testing a version of its flagship app that rewards users with virtual points, which can be exchanged for vouchers, for scrolling through content. This approach is surprising given the current debate over screen addiction.

title: Haiti establishes transitional council to choose new leaders
summary: The governing council will be responsible for selecting Haiti's next prime minister and Cabinet. This move comes as well-armed gangs have taken control of much of the capital, Port-au-Prince.

title: Italian fashion designer Roberto Cavalli dies at 83
summary: The Italian-born designer became renowned in the early 1970s for his animal prints and bold designs that remained his trademark throughout his long career.

title: Bills to liberalize Polish abortion law pass first hurdle in parliament
summary: The alliance of pro-EU parties came to power in October on a pledge to legalize abortion.

title: 'In the US, office real estate is a victim of Fridays'
summary: Even though many American employees are now back in the office post-pandemic, employers still can't get them to come in on the last day of the week. Le Monde's columnist Philippe Escande explains that this phenomenon is having an impact on office real estate well beyond US borders.

title: Macron advocates a war economy that 'produces wealth'
summary: The French president was visiting the Eurenco ammunition powder plant near Bordeaux on Thursday, where orders have soared since the start of the war in Ukraine.

title: The death of O.J. Simpson, a fallen icon and controversial figure in American society
summary: Accused of murdering his ex-wife, the former American football star was the main protagonist in a 1995 trial that became a trial of the racism of the Los Angeles police and the biases of American society.

title: With fear of crime on the rise, Democrat US cities introduce harsher policies
summary: Following Portland's example, which enacted a law recriminalizing the possession of hard drugs on April 1, several major Democrat cities have set out to toughen their stance on drug trafficking and crime, six months before the elections.

title: France warns against traveling to Iran, Lebanon, Israel and the Palestinian territories
summary: The warning follows fears of Iranian reprisals on Israel after a strike on a consulate in Syria. At a crisis meeting, the French foreign minister also called for families of French diplomats to be evacuated from Iran.

title: Permafrost degradation: The new problem facing mountain resorts
summary: Global warming is accelerating the deterioration of mountain infrastructure, in particular ski lifts and mountain huts. Renovation and reinforcement work is on the rise.

title: Vietnamese billionaire sentenced to death for massive fraud
summary: Vietnamese Communist Party General Secretary Nguyen Phu Trong's "Blazing Furnace" anti-corruption campaign is shaking the country's economic capital.

title: Fatal stabbing in Bordeaux connected to victims' alcohol consumption on Eid
summary: The Bordeaux prosecutor described a new piece of the investigation at a press conference: According to a witness, the attacker had assaulted two other people just before the incident, with the same motive.

title: Journalism and Crisis: Join Le Monde in English for a special event in New York!
summary: Le Monde's English edition crosses the Atlantic from April 15-17 for a series of events in New York City, free and open to the public.

title: High-risk demonstrations and calls for calm in New Caledonia
summary: Political tensions are running high ahead of major demonstrations in New Caledonia's capital, Nouméa, on Saturday by pro-independence supporters and loyalists.

title: Young French people are less anti-military than their elders, study shows
summary: A survey shows a 'renewed patriotism' among young people, who are more inclined to enlist than previous generations.

title: Russian military trainers with air defense system arrive in Niger
summary: The move comes as the West African nation shifts away from close counterterrorism cooperation with the United States and Europe, instead turning to Russia for security assistance.

title: French priest accused of sexually assaulting Inuit children dies
summary: Joannes Rivoire was sought by Canada for sexually abusing Inuit children more than 30 years ago but avoided extradition and prosecution. He died in a nursing home France at age 93, after a long illness.

title: Russia seeks to paralyze Ukraine by destroying its energy infrastructure
summary: All over the country, Russian strikes are deliberately targeting thermal and hydroelectric power stations. In the city of Kharkiv, plunged into darkness at night, emergency equipment is struggling to cope with power cuts.

title: Five killed in Sydney shopping center attack
summary: A knife-wielding attacker rampaged through the busy Westfield Bondi Junction mall in the Australian city. Multiple people were stabbed by the unidentified assailant, who was shot dead by a policewoman at the scene.

title: Iran seizes container ship 'affiliated' with Israel off the coast of the United Arab Emirates
summary: The seizure comes after Iranian threats against Israel in the wake of a strike on the Iranian consulate in Damascus on April 1, which killed 16 people and which Tehran blames on Israel.

title: Washington can no longer dither in support for Ukraine
summary: As Russian forces pound Kharkiv and the country's energy infrastructure, it's urgent that America's Trump-supporting Republicans lift the six-month block on a $60 billion aid package.

title: What can we expect from the 'rail pass' promised by Macron?
summary: As announced by the French president in September 2023, the plan for a one-way ticket at €49 per month for young people using certain transport throughout France will see the light of day this summer. The details are currently being worked out.

title: Davos is confronted with a rise in anti-Semitism
summary: In the Swiss resort known for hosting the annual World Economic Forum, coexistence between residents and the ultra-Orthodox Jewish community has turned sour. The city, whose image has been tarnished, is trying to mend fences.

title: When an American president bought his mistress' silence
summary: One hundred years ago, the Republican Party tried to use money to silence a mistress of Warren Harding, elected after the First World War.

title: With the finale of 'Curb Your Enthusiasm,' Larry David puts an end to Larry David once and for all
summary: The final episode of season 12 brings to a close the last iconic series of the golden age of TV comedy.

title: Pedestrians in Athens are fed up with the 'obstacle course' of run-down, congested sidewalks
summary: Outraged by the numerous broken sidewalks, which are also cluttered with tables and chairs from cafés or invaded by scooters, annoyed residents are sharing their chaotic daily lives on social media, waiting for the authorities to finally take action.

title: Senegal's opposition voters: 'It was social injustice that made us vote for Bassirou Diomaye Faye'
summary: From fishermen to students, many of the country's young people took to the polls to express their rejection of Macky Sall's liberal policies, which they felt ignored their needs.

title: Jacques Lurton, owner of Château Couhins-Lurton and globetrotter, returns to his homeland
summary: This 65-year-old winegrower, who comes from a famous Bordeaux lineage, has adapted working methods and techniques discovered abroad to his estates.
